intro: Hieracium praecisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, producing achenes that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium praecisum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
